title: Generic Stack
description: Implement a generic Stack<T> class with push, pop, and peek operations.
instructions: Create a Stack<T> class that supports push(item), pop() (returns T?), peek() (returns T?), and isEmpty(). Demonstrate with integers.

hints.text: Use a MutableList<T> as the backing storage
Push adds to end, pop removes from end
Return null from pop/peek when stack is empty

commonMistakes.mistake: Using a fixed type instead of generic T
commonMistakes.consequence: Stack only works with one type
commonMistakes.correction: Use class Stack<T> for any element type
Return null (T?) for empty stack operations

commonMistakes.mistake: Removing from front instead of back
commonMistakes.consequence: FIFO queue behavior instead of LIFO stack
commonMistakes.correction: Stack is last-in-first-out: remove from the end
